translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The eleventh section
The discussion of impermanence
Is impermanence perfected?
“Yes.”

analyzed: tāya anicca tāya anicca tā parinipphannā ati
translated: Is impermanence perfected by that impermanence?
“Is it so that one who is not a trainee is not a person who has entered upon the way?” …

analyzed: tāya anicca tāya anicca tā parinipphannā ati
translated: Is impermanence perfected by that impermanence?
“Yes.”

original: Tāya tāyeva natthi dukkhassantakiriyā, natthi vaṭṭupacchedo, natthi anupādāparinibbānanti?
analyzed: tāya tāya iva natthi dukkha ssanta kiriyā natthi vaṭṭa upacchedaḥ natthi anupādā parinibbānanti
translated: Is it the case that by that very thing there is no end to suffering, no cutting off of the cycle of existence, no attaining of final Nibbāna through nonclinging?
“Then is it that the Blessed One has not taught the Dhamma?” “One should not say so.”
Is aging perfected?
“Yes.”
Is aging perfected by that aging?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
Is aging perfected by that aging?
“Yes.”

original: Tāya tāyeva natthi dukkhassantakiriyā, natthi vaṭṭupacchedo, natthi anupādāparinibbānanti?
analyzed: tāya tāya iva natthi dukkha ssanta kiriyā natthi vaṭṭa upacchedaḥ natthi anupādā parinibbānanti
translated: Is it the case that by that very thing there is no end to suffering, no cutting off of the cycle of existence, no attaining of final Nibbāna through nonclinging?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
Is death perfected?
“Yes.”
Is death perfected by that death?
“Then is it that the Blessed One has not taught the Dhamma?” “One should not say so.”
Is death perfected by that death?
“Yes.”

original: Tassa tasseva natthi dukkhassantakiriyā, natthi vaṭṭupacchedo, natthi anupādāparinibbānanti?
analyzed: tassa tassa iva natthi dukkha ssanta kiriyā natthi vaṭṭa upacchedaḥ natthi anupādā parinibbānanti
translated: “So there is no end to suffering, no cutting off of the round, no fading away of lust, no cessation, no stilling of this suffering, this misery, this Pestilence of birth?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …

analyzed: rūpam parinipphanna rūpassa anicca tā atthi iti
translated: “Is material form produced? Is there impermanence in material form?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: anicca tā parinipphannā anicca tāya anicca tā atthi iti
translated: “Is impermanence produced? Is there impermanence in impermanence?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: rūpam parinipphanna rūpassa jarā atthi iti
translated: “Is material form produced? Is there aging in material form?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: jarā parinipphannā jarāya jarā atthi iti
translated: “Is aging produced? Is there aging in aging?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …

original: Rūpaṁ parinipphannaṁ, rūpassa bhedo atthi, antaradhānaṁ atthīti?
analyzed: rūpam parinipphanna rūpassa bhedaḥ atthi antaradhānam atthi iti
translated: “Is material form produced? Is there breaking up, disappearance, unbinding of material form?”
“Yes.”

original: Maraṇaṁ parinipphannaṁ, maraṇassa bhedo atthi, antaradhānaṁ atthīti?
analyzed: maraṇam parinipphanna maraṇassa bhedaḥ atthi antaradhānam atthi iti
translated: “Is death produced? Is there breaking up, disappearance, unbinding of death?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is feeling …
Is perception … Are fabrications …

analyzed: viññāṇam parinipphanna viññāṇassa anicca tā atthi iti
translated: Is consciousness produced? Is there impermanence in consciousness?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: anicca tā parinipphannā anicca tāya anicca tā atthi iti
translated: “Is impermanence produced? Is there impermanence in impermanence?”
“It is not so, friend.”

analyzed: viññāṇam parinipphanna viññāṇassa jarā atthi iti
translated: “Is consciousness that is fully understood subject to aging and death?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: jarā parinipphannā jarāya jarā atthi iti
translated: “Is aging that is fully understood subject to aging and death?”
“It is not so, friend.”

original: Viññāṇaṁ parinipphannaṁ, viññāṇassa bhedo atthi, antaradhānaṁ atthīti?
analyzed: viññāṇam parinipphanna viññāṇassa bhedaḥ atthi antaradhānam atthi iti
translated: “Is consciousness that is fully understood subject to destruction and disappearance?”
“Yes.”

original: Maraṇaṁ parinipphannaṁ, maraṇassa bhedo atthi, antaradhānaṁ atthīti?
analyzed: maraṇam parinipphanna maraṇassa bhedaḥ atthi antaradhānam atthi iti
translated: “Is death that is fully understood subject to destruction and disappearance?”
“It is not so, friend.”
The Discussion of Impermanence is finished.
The eleventh section is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Anusayā abyākatā, ahetukā, cittavippayuttā, aññāṇe vigate ñāṇī, ñāṇaṁ cittavippayuttaṁ,
analyzed: anusayāḥ abyākatāḥ ahetukā citta vippayuttāḥ aññāṇe vigate ñāṇī ñāṇam citta vippayutta
translated: Tendencies, indeterminate, without root cause, not conjoined with mind, when ignorance is destroyed, one who has knowledge, knowledge is not conjoined with mind,

original: yattha sadde ñāṇaṁ pavattati, iddhibalena samannāgato kappaṁ tiṭṭheyya, cittasantati
analyzed: yattha sadde ñāṇam pavattati iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya citta santati
translated: wherever knowledge occurs, endowed with the power of supernormal power, one could remain for an eon, continuity of consciousness

analyzed: samādhi dhamma ṭṭhita tā anicca tā ati
translated: concentration, stability of dhammas, impermanence.
